pli-tv-bu-vb-pc14:1.1.2: For the meaning of _senāsana_, see Appendix I: Technical Terms.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc14:2.1.9: For a discussion of these and those below, see Appendix II: Furniture.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc14:2.1.15: I have rendered _muñja_-reed and _pabbaja_-reed with the single word “reed”. I am not aware that these different species of reed can be properly distinguished in English.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc14:2.2.1: “Out in the open” renders _ajjhokāsa_. See Appendix I: Technical Terms for discussion.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc14:2.2.4: Sp-yoj 2.112: _Cammakhaṇḍoti ettha cammaṁyeva ante khaṇḍattā chinnattā cammakhaṇḍoti vuccati_, “Here _cammakhaṇḍa_ is just a hide. Because it is cut up within and made of pieces, it called a _cammakhaṇḍa_.” For the meaning of _cimilikā_, “a mat underlay”, see Appendix II: Furniture.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc14:2.3.6: Sp 2.113: _Kenaci palibuddhaṁ hotīti senāsanaṁ kenaci upaddutaṁ hotīti attho_, “_Kenaci palibuddhaṁ hoti_: the meaning is that the furniture is controlled by something.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc14:2.3.7: “Emergency” renders _āpadāsu_. See Appendix I: Technical Terms for discussion.
